body: The example file contains the solar radiation simulation results of a group of points on building facade and the visualization of the facade mesh based on these results. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Fxq0VavCSuC5q2Oc5vN1b1yMYn-RNXBLoJ*7RcppPwS3GAetZgwDJSQk-U3ekV3llooMvipSlWdtdgeLcgCIhonsXgqfRzhw/Image1.png) I want to use the following workflow to filter those meshes, or surface patches, based on certain threshold value. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Fxq0VavCSuBlMoXM1WqQIt5o5M2XAkAtdrK4fG*nKJPSrPenY5UiV5udDiTm-ro1dAwckAz4oF*BlJBhA8afvg4A4MLLVuoU/Image3.png) However, the workflow massed up the order of the surface, or the order of the results, leading to a mismatch between patch and its respective result. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Fxq0VavCSuC1IAtiNc7N-x8eLQE6e2GdgI8ompXlwQuVkXsRMWbo3rmCmNiP8oMFMThTMsSiO6qPsiC8-DDFRKYWYLPS-JCk/Image2.png) May I ask how to solve this issue related to the filtering and re-grouping of meshes? Thank you!
topic: how to filter a mesh based on result
